title: how do I get separate inboxes for my 3 email addresses in Thunderbird for Android
creator: j.fillenham

title: Not getting mail on Android devices
creator: dalewebb1
content: Not getting any mail on my Android devices. Had to get a new Google account as the old was was very screwed up. I have TWO email accounts: GMail and Outlook. Outlookk account forwards all incoming mail to GMail account, so I should get mail only from GMail, but both accounts are set up in TB anyway. Outlook is set up as IMAP. GMail is set up as POP, necessary for some reason GMail setup (gmail.google.com) told me. Something about keeping message on the server or deleting them. Have an APP PASSWORD for GMail account because TB didn't like the POP account. Set up TB on my laptop physically. To speed up rest of work, I used TB "Export to mobile" on my phone and tablet. That's when the problems seemed to start. Finally had to set up TB on BOTH Android devices, which as far as I know, I did correctly. With that background, why am I not getting email on either Android device? Any help greatly appreciated.

title: Picking folders for Android Unified inbox
creator: rick@thejohnleegroup.com
content:
Attempting to acclimate to TB Android after long awaited anticipation!

Where are settings for choosing what folders are included in the Unified inbox?

Currently, it is overwhelming having ALL drafts, sent, received, forwarded et al appearing.

Also, seems I can't really delete a simple email. I delete then it pops back up in Unified box. Apparently, even my trash is included. ðŸ¤·

I have yet to find "common" email settings to select and organize folders.

HELP!
